Package edu.ntnu.idi.bidata.recipe

Class CookBook

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.bidata.recipe.CookBook
public class CookBook extends Object
The CookBook class represents a collection of recipes. It provides methods to add, remove and retrieve recipes.
Since:
13.11.2024
Version:
1.0.0

  • Constructor Details

    • CookBook

      public CookBook()
      Constructor for the class CookBook. It will initialize and empty map of recipes.

  • Method Details

    • getAllRecipes

      public Map<String,Recipe> getAllRecipes()
      Accessor method for recipes.
      Returns:
      A set of all recipes.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if no recipes are found.

    • getRecipe

      public Recipe getRecipe(String recipeName)
      Accessor method for recipe.
      Parameters:
      recipeName - The name of the recipe to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The given recipe, if it does exist.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - will be thrown if the recipe does not exist.

    • addRecipe

      public void addRecipe(Recipe recipe)
      Mutator method for recipe. Will add a recipe to the cookbook.
      Parameters:
      recipe - recipe to be added.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the recipe provided is null.

    • removeRecipe

      public void removeRecipe(String recipeName)
      Mutator method for recipe. Will remove the given recipe from the cookbook.
      Parameters:
      recipeName - Name of recipe to be removed.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided recipe name is null or empty.
      NoSuchElementException - if the recipe to remove does not exist.

    • recipeRecommendation

      public Recipe recipeRecommendation(FoodStorage foodStorage)
      Accessor method that will recommend a recipe, based on what is already in the given foodStorage. Improvement inspired by CoPilot.
      Parameters:
      foodStorage - storage to check for groceries.
      Returns:
      Will return a recipe, if there are enough groceries.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided food storage is null.
      NoSuchElementException - if there is no recipe to make from the groceries.

    • matchRecipeToGrocery

      public boolean matchRecipeToGrocery(FoodStorage foodStorage, Recipe recipe)
      Method checks if a given recipe can be made with the available groceries in the food storage.
      Parameters:
      foodStorage - The food storage to check for available groceries.
      recipe - The recipe to match with the groceries.
      Returns:
      true if possible to make, and false if not possible.
